title: Campton Mercantile
description: This photo shows the large Campton Mercantile Store. To the right of it is the Steptoe Drug Store. The Drugstore was built in 1908 by the Steptoe Drug Company.
subject: Businesses;Mercantiles;Main Street

title: McGill Drugstore
description: Early photo circa 1912. The McGill Drugstore was built in 1908 and was owned and operated by the Steptoe Drug Co. In 1912 it was changed to the McGill Drugstore. The building to the left of the drugstore was the Campton Mercantile and the McGill Post Office was to the right of the drugstore.
subject: Businesses;Drug Stores;Main Street

title: Leader Store
description: A photo of the east side of McGill main street. The date could be 1912-1915. The Leader Store on the right was in operation in 1914. The large building on the far left is the Clubhouse. The top floor is not finished in this photo. It was completed in 1915-16.
subject: Businesses;Main Street

title: Converter Construction
description:
View in the Converter building showing construction of the new brick converter in the background and two of the clay-lined converters in position for operating the casting machine moulds in which copper is cast in bars is at the left of the picture.
The ladels on the floor are used for transferring hot copper and slag between the converters and the casting machine.
subject: Businesses;Kennecott Copper Company;Converters;Smelters;Men

title: Converter Construction
description: Photo taken on April 24, 1911 shows construction of the new type Pierce Smith converters that will replace the old clay-lined converters.
subject: Businesses;Kennecott Copper Company;Converters;Smelters

title: Early Clay Converters
description: Early clay converters in the Smelter Converter building. The workmen are testing out the crane by lifting three of the small converters. This crane was not moved to the new Converter building in 1935.
subject: Businesses;Kennecott Copper Company;Converters;Smelters;Men

title: Five Operating Converters
description: View in the Converter building showing the new brick-lined Converters, and five of the operating Converters in operating place.
subject: Businesses;Kennecott Copper Company;Converters;Smelters;Men
